page.title: 01Barnburgh and Harlington
page.content: The villages of Barnburgh and Harlington are interrelated,it is difficult to see where one village ends and the other begins. Fifteen to twenty years ago a single track railway separated them but now the railway has disappeared and the cutting has been filled in and the definite division has gone,the thin strip of land remaining is often referred to as "no-man's land". The villages still sit in lovely countryside,despite their quite considerable growth over recent years and even though Barnburgh Colliery stands close by. The villages contain a mixture of old,architecturally interesting buildings, farms and cottages, and new buildings , houses and bungalows.
